intro: Xolisma dictyoneura, commonly known as the desert hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It is characterized by its tall, spiny stems and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that bloom in shades of yellow and orange. The plant has thick, waxy leaves that help reduce water loss in hot, dry environments. It produces capsule fruits that contain numerous seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Xolisma dictyoneura is well adapted to survive in harsh desert conditions, making it an important component of its ecosystem.
